svcprocinfo.para:

for the following discussion.

The work light switch (441) receives power from B2 battery stud on circuit 65A at terminal 4. This circuit is protected by 15A fuse F2-A (fuse F2-A and B2 stud are located in the cab power distribution center).

The work light switch is a two-pole, single throw switch. With the switch in the ON position, power is sent from switch terminal 5 to the work lights. The lights are grounded through sleeper/cab harness connector (472) at cab ground adapter (454).

svcsubproc.title: Work Light Indicator Light (423)
svcsubproc.para: The work light "indicator" light (and all other lights in the left gauge cluster) is powered (key ON) by ignition voltage from circuit 28A. With the work light switch ON, the circuit between work light switch terminals 1 and 2 is closed, grounding the work light "indicator light", causing it to turn ON (only if the key switch is ON).
